      • getVariable

        public int getVariable(java.lang.String name,
                       int line)
                throws UndefinedVariableException
        Description copied from interface: Scope
        Gets the value of the specified variable in the current scope. If it is not in the current scope, then it checks the parent scope.
        Specified by:
        getVariable in interface Scope
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the variable
        line - the current line of this program (only needed in case of error)
        Returns:
        the value of the named variable
        Throws:
        UndefinedVariableException - if the variable is not defined in this scope, or any parent scope

      • setVariable

        public void setVariable(java.lang.String name,
                        int val)
        Description copied from interface: Scope
        Changes the value of the named variable. This first checks for the nearest scope that already contains the variable, then changes its value there. If the variable doesn't exist in this scope, then it is created locally.
        Specified by:
        setVariable in interface Scope
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the variable
        val - the new value for the variable

      • hasVariable

        public boolean hasVariable(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: Scope
        Checks if this scope, or the parent scopes contain this variable.
        Specified by:
        hasVariable in interface Scope
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the variable
        Returns:
        true if the variable exists in scope

      • getFunction

        public Function getFunction(java.lang.String name,
                            int line)
                     throws UndefinedFunctionException
        Description copied from interface: Scope
        Gets the named function in scope.
        Specified by:
        getFunction in interface Scope
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the function
        line - the current line of this program (only needed in case of error)
        Returns:
        the named Function
        Throws:
        UndefinedFunctionException - if the function was not declared in scope
